titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Walter De la Mare Papers , 1912-1984
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Walter De la Mare Papers ,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Dorothy L. Hatch, 1991 and 1993.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Walter De la Mare Papers , M0589, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes letters, manuscripts, muscical scores, and printed ephemera collected by Dorothy Hatch. Major correspondents include John Black, Richard Church, Leonard Clark, Graham Greene, Dorothy Hatch, Edward Marsh, Barbara Morison, Christopher Morley, Lady Ottoline Morrell, F. C. Owlett, Herman Peschmann, and Elizabeth Myers Powys.
Includes poetry and letters by Edward Marsh. Clippings of drama and book reviews.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.persname: Morrell, Ottoline Violet Anne Cavendish-Bentinck, Lady, 1873-1938.
controlaccess.subject: English literature--20th century.

scopecontent.p: both items previously enclosed in a copy of Marsh's autobiography

Walter de la Mare: An Exhibition of Books, Letters, Manuscripts. March 3 - April 5, 1969.Rare Book Department, Temple University Libraries, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Inside catalog, letter from Thomas Whitehead, Rare Book and Manuscript Curator, to Dorothy Hatch, certifying receipt of loan items for the de la Mare exhibition. Also, a news release of the exhibition.
